page.title: 12A Postman's Day
page.content: At 4am I get up and walk to work because the mail arrives at the Post Office at 4.30am. The bags are emptied and the letters are separated from the packets. The letters are then hand sorted into all the different deliveries. Vans arrive at the Post Office from the Parcel Office and I get a lift to the start of my delivery. Each delivery has between four and six hundred houses to call at. I start my delivery at about 7am finishing between 9.00 and 9.30am. When I finish I catch the bus back to the Post Office and have my meal break. After this I prepare and then go out on my second delivery. There are only about 10% of the first delivery letters and packets. After the second delivery I go straight home.
